alert.note: Alert for Craighead; Crittenden; Cross; Poinsett (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 1:19AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Craighead, Poinsett, northwestern Crittenden and northeastern Cross Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 119 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Waldenburg to 7 miles north of Parkin to Jennette. Movement was north at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jonesboro, Trumann, Marked Tree, Earle, Harrisburg, Bono, Lepanto, Bay, Parkin, Tyronza, Weiner, Cherry Valley, Cash, Jennette, Egypt, Waldenburg, Greenfield, Fisher, Three Forks and Payneway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
